image.altText: exterior view of aged care facility

props.synopsis: Access to respite aged care in Canberra will become even tougher from June, when the ACT government will shut a 15-bed facility in Canberra's south.

title.children: Aged care respite facility to be shut despite growing demand

image.altText: Judge Salvatore Vasta

props.synopsis: Federal Circuit Court Judge Salvatore Vasta has won his High Court bid for immunity from being sued by a man wrongly jailed during a family property dispute.

title.children: Federal Circuit Court Judge wins High Court bid for immunity

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: Dawson has lodged a special leave application in the High Court, as he seeks to secure a new trial, 40 years after he killed his wife.

title.children: Convicted killer Chris Dawson launches High Court appeal bid

image.altText: Clive speaks at a podium in front of a blue National Press Club of Australia backdrop and gestures with his hands.

props.synopsis: Clive Palmer has lost his High Court bid to re-register the United Australia Party for this year's federal election, meaning the party's candidates will not be identified with the UAP on ballot papers for the House of Representatives and the Senate.

title.children: Clive Palmer loses bid to re-register United Australia Party

image.altText: outside view of federal court in australia

props.synopsis: A group of Canberra's social housing tenants are set to get their day in the Federal Court, with the way cleared for a class action against the ACT government over a plan to move them from their homes.

title.children: Class action by social housing tenants cleared to run

image.altText: an old man sits on a walking aid

props.synopsis: Former Christian Brother John Vincent Roberts, 83, has pleaded guilty to three counts of indecent assault which took place when he took his 15-year-old victim on drives to a forest.

title.children: Teenage boy 'empty inside' after being assaulted by teacher in 1980s

image.altText: A closed sign blocking a four-lane road in a city.

props.synopsis: Businesses on the western side of London Circuit, now off-limits for vehicles between Northbourne and Edinburgh Avenues, face a choice of adapting or closing as light rail construction work sees customers decrease.

title.children: Businesses adapt or shut as light rail construction closes London Circuit

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Former Scout and police officer Alexander John Clancy is facing 11 charges against two alleged victims, including rape, committing acts of indecency and using electronic means to deprave a young person.

title.children: Former Scout faces trial for alleged historic child sex offences

image.altText: Two women stand with an arm around one another, wearing traditional furs.

props.synopsis: The remains of two Moriori ancestors begin their journey home to New Zealand from the National Museum of Australia in Canberra as part a years-long repatriation process.

title.children: Moriori ancestors' remains 'coming home' after years in Canberra museum

image.altText: A car caught in a flash flood while a 4WD ploughs through water behind.

props.synopsis: Although February is still peak severe weather season, the majority of extreme events this month are being exacerbated by abnormally warm waters off our coastlines.

title.children: Australia facing heatwaves, drenching and cyclones

image.altText: A closeup of a woman with dark hair in a bun looking down, wearing a black coat in front of grey sky.

props.synopsis: Never before has an Australian sportswoman been embroiled in as high profile a scandal as the one Sam Kerr finds herself in now, writes national sport reporter David Mark.

title.children: A turning point for Australian sport: Sam Kerr is in uncharted waters

image.altText: A view of Lake Liddell with the Liddell power station reflected in the background.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's promised nuclear power plants could consume three times more water than existing coal sites, posing a question of where that water would come from.

title.children: Nuclear plants could require three times more water than used by coal

image.altText: Brielle holds her daughter as she looks off a balcony.

props.synopsis: Apartment living is a key pillar of government plans to ease the housing crisis by densifying well-connected parts of Australia's largest cities. But some have questioned the viability of the plans, saying the current stock of apartments was poorly suited for families.

title.children: Could a high-rise apartment replace the classic family home?

image.altText: A man in tactical gear holds a training assault rifle during a training exercise.

props.synopsis: The move comes in preparation for a possible resumption of fighting in Gaza if Hamas does not release more Israeli hostages on Saturday.

title.children: Israel calls up reservists amid Gaza ceasefire uncertainty

image.altText: A star with a white stream moving towards the top right hand of the image.

props.synopsis: A special telescope 40 kilometres off the south French coast has detected a slippery particle called a neutrino — and it's unlike anything physicists have seen before.

title.children: Record-breaking 'ghost' particle spotted by underwater telescope

image.altText: John F Kennedy, Jaqueline Kennedy and John Connolly riding in an open-top limousine in front of another black car

props.synopsis: In 2025, questions remain about what else there is to know about the killing, why Donald Trump wants to expose the unknown, and whether the remaining files will alter the only version of events the world has ever known.

title.children: After 62 years, this is why Trump wants to expose JFK assassination files

image.altText: Interior Pot lines at an aluminium smelter

props.synopsis: Few in the industry or working behind the scenes are willing to predict what will come next with US President Donald Trump's steel and aluminium tariffs.

title.children: Why Australian aluminium is in the White House's sights

image.altText: A young boy wearing a basketball singlet smiles for the camera.

props.synopsis: The WA Supreme Court hears testimony from the teenager at the centre of a "love triangle" that sparked a series of events ending in the alleged murder of Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey.

title.children: 'Love triangle' set off events ending in Cassius Turvey's death, trial told

image.altText: headshot of Liam Neeson

props.synopsis: Northern Ireland-born superstar Liam Neeson hits regional Victoria for The Mongoose, his third film in the state in four years.

title.children: Hollywood action star wows fans ahead of Victorian shoot for new movie

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: Albanese sits at the despatch box in the lower house.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is keeping open the low-probability option of a last-minute dash to the White House ahead of the federal election if the government judges it would sway Donald Trump towards granting Australia a tariff exemption.

title.children: PM keeps door open to unlikely pre-poll Trump trip if tariff crisis worsens

image.altText: Helen Haines mid-sentence gesturing with her hands open with a string of lights in a corridor out of focus behind her

props.synopsis: Indi MP Helen Haines, who could become a kingmaker if the federal election returns a hung parliament, will make unpicking a deal struck by Labor and the Coalition on political donations a key negotiating point for her support.

title.children: Independent Haines will seek to undo electoral reform in hung parliament

image.altText: Belle Gibson, with her hair in a ponytail, wearing black sunglasses and a black coat.

props.synopsis: Netflix is purporting to tell the story of wellness scammer Belle Gibson in their new series, but the show stops short of showing the messy legal fallout following Gibson's professional implosion.

title.children: After her cancer scam rocked Australia, where is Belle Gibson now?

image.altText: Generic photos of apartments, balconies

props.synopsis: Not every person with a HECS debt will "suddenly" be approved for a home loan, the Australian Banking Association chief says. But some are hopeful the new rules will be enough to get them over the line.

title.children: Relaxed lending rules for student debt holders won't benefit all

image.altText: File photo: Federal Parliament House (ABC Canberra)

props.synopsis: Australia has been ranked 10th in Transparency International's annual Corruption Index. It's the first time since 2016 that Australia has been placed in the top 10.

title.children: Australia improves ranking on the global corruption index

image.altText: pedestrians walk past the reserve bank of australia building

props.synopsis: The figure that influences how high people's mortgage repayments are set has been 4.35 per cent since November 2023.

title.children: Why interest rates haven't changed for a year

image.altText: Elon Musk wearing a black jacket and black 'Make America Great Again' hat while crossing his arms in front of him

props.synopsis: During an appearance alongside the tech billionaire, US President Donald Trump said the department had uncovered 'shocking' evidence of wasteful spending within government.

title.children: 'We're moving fast': Elon Musk defends DOGE cuts to federal workforce

image.altText: A Matildas players dribbles the ball with her right foot while under defensive pressure from a USA opponent.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr has been cleared by the courts but her public image has been damaged, and questions remain around her suitability to represent her country.

title.children: Sam Kerr's trial started uncomfortable conversations about anti-white racism

image.altText: A man in yellow snow jacket talks to a man in black coat and beanie outside a blue building.

props.synopsis: A parliamentary inquiry into the importance of Antarctica to Australia's national interests has made 13 recommendations, including increased inspections to ensure other countries are complying with non-militarisation and environmental obligations.

title.children: Push for more Antarctic inspections to prevent 'militarisation by stealth'

image.altText: An older man in a suit and red, spotted tie, speaks into a microphone on a podium during an address.

props.synopsis: The major parties have agreed to more than double the donation threshold, ending a months-long stalemate to strike a deal that will infuriate the crossbench.

title.children: Labor and Coalition strike electoral reform deal

image.altText: Gout Gout holding his shoe to his ear like a telephone, celebrating a race win

props.synopsis: The brightest new star of Australian athletics, sprint sensation Gout Gout, is set to contest the nation's oldest footrace.

title.children: Teen sprinting sensation Gout Gout to run in Stawell Gift

image.altText: A large crowd of people protesting.

props.synopsis: A United Nations report says Bangladesh's former government was behind systematic attacks and killings of protesters as it worked to hold onto power last year.

title.children: UN says former Bangladesh government behind 'crimes against humanity'

image.altText: Bridget, left, and Roxster beams as they stand in the middle of a party with a pool behind them, his shirt wet, see through

props.synopsis: Bridget Jones: Mad About the Boy is a reintroduction to the character we've loved for decades — and a fitting goodbye.

title.children: Why Bridget Jones is back for one last hurrah

image.altText: Two intruders break into a home looking for car keys.

props.synopsis: Amid increasing public frustration and anger about youth crime, Victoria's latest statistics show youth crime is at record levels and police are blaming repeat offenders.

title.children: Watch as youths break into house to steal car keys as part of crime wave

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: Dawson has lodged a special leave application in the High Court, as he seeks to secure a new trial, 40 years after he killed his wife.

title.children: Convicted killer Chris Dawson launches High Court appeal bid
